definitions.definition: to smell something by taking air in through your nose:
examples: He sniffed his socks to see if they needed washing.

definitions.definition: to take air in quickly through your nose, usually to stop the liquid inside the nose from flowing out:
examples: You're sniffing a lot - do you have a cold?

definitions.definition: to speak in an unpleasant way, showing that you have a low opinion of something:
examples: [ + speech ] "They didn't even serve wine at dinner!" she sniffed.

definitions.definition: a quick breath in through the nose to smell something, or to stop liquid in the nose from coming out:
examples: Take a sniff of this medicine - it smells horrible, doesn't it?
